newsitem.title: USA: Chevron's Chandeleur Pipe Line to expand.
newsitem.headline: Chevron's Chandeleur Pipe Line to expand.

text.p: Chandeleur Pipe Line on Monday said it plans to expand natural gas delivery by an extra 200 million cubic feet per day, directly linking an affiliated plant at Venice, La., to Mississippi pipelines.
The pipe line company is a unit of Chevron Corp.
"This expansion will provide producers with gas at Venice a new outlet that bypasses growing pipeline bottlenecks in southeast Louisiana," says Bill Erwin, president of Chandeleur.
The expanded line will start up in January 1999, after the company adds 26 miles of 24-inch pipe from Venice to an offshore platform at Main Pass 41, where the Chandeleur pipeline now originates.
An additional four miles of 24-inch pipe will be added onshore at Pascagoula, Miss., to connect to the new Destin Pipeline, the company said.
The new sections will help producers bypass bottlenecks in Louisiana as line space nears capacity in the next few years, the company said.
Chandeleur expects to file its certificate applications by March 31 with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, which must approve the project.
